question: Which sentence best describes the beginning of Python?

answers.text: CWI hired Guido van Rossum to design a new programming language to compete with C++.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: This statement is partly true. Python did not take several years to become open source.

answers.text: Python started out as a hobby and became open source after several years of development.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Python started out as Guido van Rossum's hobby, not his company's official project.

answers.text: van Rossum posted Python's source code online after working on the language for one year.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Making Python open source early on allowed for many programmers to provide feedback.

detailedSolution: Making Python open source early on allowed for many programmers to provide feedback.
